channel.title: Algebraic Topology by Hatcher on Adar Kahiri
channel.description: Recent content in Algebraic Topology by Hatcher on Adar Kahiri

item.title: Problems
item.description: Problem 10 Show that a space \(X\) is contractible if and only if every map \(f: X \rightarrow Y\), for arbitrary \(Y\), is nullhomotopic. Similarly, show \(X\) is contractible if and only if every map \(f: Y \rightarrow X\) is nullhomotopic. IÃ¥f \(X\) is contractible, then its identity map \(\mathbb{I}: X \rightarrow X\) is nullhomotopic. Let \(h: X \times I \rightarrow X\) be a homotopy between \(\mathbb{I}\) and a constant map (This map exists since the identity is nullhomotopic).
